keyword: how many calories in wonton soup
title: How Many Calories in Wonton Soup?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in wonton soup per cup, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, sodium, and tips for variations in this light Chinese broth.
h1: How Many Calories in Wonton Soup?
assumptions: Standard 1-cup serving (245 g) of pork-filled wontons in chicken broth with green onions and bok choy; restaurant-style, no added MSG or thickeners.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, wonton filling, broth base, portion size, and restaurant preparation. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One cup of wonton soup contains about 71 calories and 4.5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant info.

faqs.q: How many calories in a bowl of wonton soup?
faqs.a: About 71 calories per 1-cup serving; larger bowls (2 cups) double to ~142 calories.

faqs.q: Is wonton soup high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 800 mg per cup due to brothâ€”opt for low-sodium versions to reduce intake.

faqs.q: What are the macros in wonton soup?
faqs.a: Per cup: 7.5 g carbs, 4.5 g protein, 2.5 g fat, with minimal fiber and sugars.

faqs.q: How does restaurant wonton soup compare to homemade?
faqs.a: Restaurant versions often have more sodium and calories (up to 100 kcal/cup) from added seasonings or oil.

faqs.q: Can wonton soup fit a low-carb diet?
faqs.a: Yes, at 7.5 g carbs per cup it's low-carb, but watch wonton wrappers if strictly keto.
